title: How is nakula special in Mahabharata? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nakula, the fourth of the five Pandavas and one among the twins. Nakula and Sahadeva were born to Madri with the help of the boon from Kunthi from the Ashwini kumaras. Nakula is the handsome guy among the five Pandavas and married Draupadi and begotten a son, Satanika. After the demise of Pandu and Madri, Madri’s brother Shalya intended to make Nakula and Sahadeva as heir to the throne of Madra, his kingdom. Nakula refused the offer stating that they are not the real children of Madri as they are offered as blessings by Ashwini Kumaras to Madri. However Shalya convinced Nakula and Sahadeva to be his heir but under Sahadeva’s one condition that they will continue to be with other three brothers in Hastinapur. This shows how Nakula was deeply in love with his step-mom Kunthi and her sons! When Yudhistra lost the game of dice, Nakula vowed that he would kill Shakuni who was the main cause for their hardships. Like his brother Sahadeva he is also well versed in astrology but he would forget the predictions once it is said. In Mahabharata war, Nakula desired Draupada to be the Commander-in-chief for Pandava army. However Yudishtra chose Dhristadhyuman to be the commander-in-chief. Nakula with his war tactics defeated many warriors in the Mahabharata like Dussasana, Shalya, Shakuni’s son Ulook, and slained Shakuni on 18th day. Apart from warfare, Nakula has mastered horse breeding, treating illness of horse, a good charioteer, and an expert in Ayurveda. Nakula is known for his sword fighting and is said that he would ride his horse and he would deflect every rain drop with his swords and would emerge completely dry. After the demise of Krishna, Pandavas retired to Himalayas along with a dog, Yama himself. Nakula was the third one to die in the expedition after Draupadi and his brother Sahadeva. It is said that he died because of his prudence that he is the only handsome in the world!

Nakula is as important in the Mahabharata as the appendix is in the human body. He is just a character who is not much etched out in the Mahabharata. He along with Sahadeva is a fringe character amongst the Pandava Brothers. Nakula and Sahadeva were twins born to Madri, the “other” wife of Pandu who committed sati in Pandu’s pyre. As pandu was incapable of impregnating his wife (owing to a curse), they were divine sons of the Ashwini Kumaras (Twin Gods of medicine and healing) ( Once Sage Durvasa visited Kuntibhoja. He was extremely pleased by the services and comforts offered by Kunti, and offered her a boon to invoke any god to bear a child. ) Marriages Nakula married Draupadi during this period and had a son, Satanika.During his brother's Rajasuya, Nakula was tasked with bringing to heel several kingdoms. One of these was the Chedi Kingdom. To cement an alliance, Nakula married Karenumati, daughter of Dhristaketu who was the son of Sishupala; she bore him one son, Niramitra.These were Nakula’ special skills Horse-keeping: Nakula's deep understanding of horse breeding and training is documented in the Mahabharata after the death of Narakasura by Krishna. In a conversation with Virata, Nakula claimed to know the art of treating all illnesses of horses. He was also a highly skilled charioteer.Ayurveda: Being a son of the physicians, Ashwini Kumaras, Nakula was also believed to be an expert in Ayurveda.Sword Fighting: Nakula and his brother, Sahadeva were skilled sword fighters. Nakula was said to ride his horse in the rain and used his sword to deflect every drop. He would emerge completely dry.Diplomacy: Nakula was very handsome and charming man. He was a skilled diplomat.In the war Nakula was defeated by Duryodhana and Karna, tus affirming the minor status of the character of Nakula in the Mahabharata Source: Nakula - Wikipedia
